head.title: A Proud Bronx Basks In Yankees' Radiance

hedline.hl1: A Proud Bronx Basks In Yankees' Radiance

block.p: When she walks her dog, Karmelia Wilmot can see inside Yankee Stadium. On Saturday, baseball fans around the country will be focused on the same spot, in a sliver of the Bronx she calls home. For Bronx residents, the Yankees' success has had a particular resonance, in some ways typifying the borough's own resurgence after years as a dismal urban metaphor. For many, pride has overcome bittersweet feelings about a team that may see its future elsewhere.
